Articles.Content: We've had a few scenes with bases and space stations but none of them appear to have any impressive comms components. If we're going interplanetary then we should need some pretty large communication infrastructure, we could definitely use some Arecibo-sized comm dishes

26 minutes ago, Jack Mcslay said:

We've had a few scenes with bases and space stations but none of them appear to have any impressive comms components. If we're going interplanetary then we should need some pretty large communication infrastructure, we could definitely use some Arecibo-sized comm dishes

It's all probably tiny compared to the base considering they're size.

you should be more concerned about interstellar colonies, your going to need a dish the size of a condo or bigger.

I think the first interstellar missions you have will be without connection to the KSC because you have to manufacture an antenna like that.

43 minutes ago, Minmus Taster said:

It's all probably tiny compared to the base considering they're size.

you should be more concerned about interstellar colonies, your going to need a dish the size of a condo or bigger.

I think the first interstellar missions you have will be without connection to the KSC because you have to manufacture an antenna like that.

One thing that might be cool would be non-decelerating probe flybys to gather information on new systems before sending a full colony ship, in which case you'd probably want a huge deployable array, possibly daisy-chained to multiple sequential probes.
